history.content: 61B in the Fall was the best class I've taken at Berkeley tbh. I loved the project-oriented nature of the course, and it wasn't especially rushed (as I imagine the case would be in the summer). As long as you put in a ton of effort into the projects you'll be guaranteed a good grade too, unlike with other iterations of 61B that are more dependent on performance in exams.

children.subject: I took CS61BL in the summer and really enjoyed it. It's one of my favorite classes I've taken, and I thought the labs were helpful. It is a bit more fast-paced than the regular class, but it was still manageable. The student instructors were all very qualified. The summer course also seemed to build a close community between the course staff, the lab assistants, and the students.

history.content: I'm currently trying to figure out which one to take. I realize that 61BL covers the same content as 61B in a lab based format, but I was curious as to what the pros/cons might be as compared to taking it in the Fall with Hilfinger
history.subject: CS 61BL in the Summer vs. 61B in the Fall
